comment.author: 69746795@N05
comment._content: Is this the Masonic Lodge? On Hay Street?

comment.author: 92581505@N02
comment._content: This building once stood behind the town hall. To be accurate it was the building directly to the east of the town hall, on Hay Street. See this link for a State Library of WA online photo from 1868 which looks west along Hay Street from Pier Street. It shows the town hall being built, and this building behind it. catalogue.slwa.wa.gov.au/record=b2111865~S6#.UQNrTyesiSo And yes, It does seems to have been a Freemason's Lodge, look at the markings above the windows.

comment.author: 92670299@N04
comment._content: 'St John's Lodge' was a Masonic lodge of 1867 in Hay Street, designed by Richard Jewell (1810-1891) – see also photo 24 in the National Archives UK sequence.  Superceded by a J. Talbot Hobbs design in 1896.
